isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - ASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY (MODEL RTLO-718)

note.para: Each mainshaft gear must have its I.D. snap ring installed before placement on the mainshaft. Do not replace reverse gear I.D. snap ring.

Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to the mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with gear hub clutching teeth. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each mainshaft gear.

Axial clearance (end play) limits are .006" to .015" (0.15 to 0.4 mm) for all mainshaft gears. If the axial clearance is less than the minimum .006" tolerance, the limit washer should be replaced with a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the axial clearance is greater than the maximum .015" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed. This will decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

step1.para: With mainshaft pilot-end down, secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks ( Figure 152).

figure.caption: Figure 152. Install Roll Pin in Keyway

step1.para: If previously removed, install the roll pin in keyway ( Figure 152).
Position the 4th speed gear limit washer (white) in the mainshaft 1st or bottom groove with washer flat side up. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 153).

figure.caption: Figure 153. Install Plastic Air Line in Keyway

step1.para: Start at the mainshaft bottom and install a plastic air line in the keyway to lock the washer in place. As limit washers and gears are installed, continue to push the plastic air line up ( Figure 153).
Position 4th speed gear spacer against the 4th speed gear washer ( Figure 154).

figure.caption: Figure 154. Position 4th Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: With clutching teeth down and engaged with spacer external splines, position 4th speed gear on mainshaft ( Figure 154).
Install the 3rd speed gear and spacer with clutching teeth up and against 4th speed gear ( Figure 155).
With the washer flat side down, position limit washer against the spacer. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 156).

figure.caption: Figure 156. Rotate Washer Until Washer Splines and Mainshaft Splines Align

step1.para: Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 156).
Insert a .006" feeler gauge and a .015" feeler gauge between gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 157). If out of tolerance, change the limit washer against the mainshaft spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 157. Insert Feeler Gauge Between Gear Hub and Mainshaft Spacer

step1.para: With the missing internal splines aligned with the plastic line, install the 2nd-3rd speed sliding clutch ( Figure 158).
With the washer flat side up, position the 2nd speed gear limit washer in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 159).

figure.caption: Figure 159. Push Air Line Up to Lock Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 159).
Install 2nd gear spacer ( Figure 159).
With clutching teeth down, position 2nd speed gear on mainshaft engaging with spacer external splines ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Position 2nd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: With clutching teeth up, install 1st speed gear on the shaft against the 2nd speed gear ( Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Install 1st Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Position 1st speed gear spacer against 1st speed gear, engaging spacer external splines with gear clutching teeth ( Figure 162).

figure.caption: Figure 162. Position 1st Speed Gear Spacer Against 1st Speed Gear

step1.para: With washer flat side down, position the limit washer against the spacer. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 162).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 162).
Insert a .006" feeler gauge and a .015" feeler gauge between the gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 163). If out of tolerance, change the limit washer against the mainshaft spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 163. Insert Feeler Gauge Between Gear Hub and Mainshaft Spacer

step1.para: Align the missing sliding clutch internal spline with the mainshaft key, and install the 1st-reverse speed sliding clutch ( Figure 164).

figure.caption: Figure 164. Position Reverse Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: With the washer flat side up, position the reverse gear limit washer (white) in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 164).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 164).
Position reverse speed gear spacer against the limit washer ( Figure 164).
Install reverse gear on the mainshaft. Engage the gear clutching teeth with spacer external splines and sliding clutch. Move the reverse gear against the 1st speed gear ( Figure 165).

figure.caption: Figure 165. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the air line and insert the mainshaft key ( Figure 165and Figure 166).

note.para: Be careful not to move gears while doing this procedure. The limit washers are unlocked and can rotate which would cause the gears to drop.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft from the vise ( Figure 167).

On the shaft front, align the sliding clutch missing internal spline with the mainshaft key and install the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch. Engage the sliding clutch external splines with the 4th speed gear clutching teeth ( Figure 167).

note.para: Make sure reverse gear is against 1st speed gear, the mainshaft key is in the keyway, and the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch is engaged into 4th speed gear.
